gov.ncbi.pmc.dtdanalyzer

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.ncbi.pmc.dtdanalyzer.App

  • public class App
extends Object
    The App class consolidates command-line options, configuration information, and other things that are shared across all of the dtdanalyzer tools.

        Constructor. The list of options should be in the same order that you want them to be output in the usage message.

   boolean _wantOutput,
   int _numDtds,
   String _cmdLineSyntax,
   String _usageHeader)
        Constructor. Use this form when the command will accept more than one DTD argument; for example, dtdcompare.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        This function does all the work, after the App object has been instantiated. This must be a separate instance method, rather than being invoked from the constructor, because it calls the application class, which might call back to us. The easiest way for it to call back to us is via other instance methods.

      • handleOption

        public boolean handleOption(org.apache.commons.cli.Option opt)
        Here is where we handle any of the common command-line options. This will be invoked when the application class doesn't know what to do with a given option.

      • getHome

        public File getHome()
        Get the home directory. This is passed in from our startup scripts as the value of the DTDANALYZER_HOME system property.

      • getLine

        public org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine getLine()
        Get the parsed command line.

      • getActiveOpts

        public org.apache.commons.cli.Options getActiveOpts()
        Get the currently active Options

      • getDtdSpec

        public DtdSpecifier getDtdSpec()
        Get the DtdSpecifier.

      • getDtdSpec

        public DtdSpecifier getDtdSpec(int i)
        Same, but use this when there are multiple dtds allowed. No range checking done here, use responsibly.

      • getDtdSpecType

        public int getDtdSpecType()
        Gets the DTD specification type, either 'd', 's', or 'p'.

      • getDtdSpecType

        public int getDtdSpecType(int i)
        Same, but use this one when there are multiple dtds allowed. No range checking done here, use responsibly.

      • getDtdSpecValue

        public String getDtdSpecValue()
        Gets the DTD specification value, either a filename ('d'), a system identifier, or a public identifier.

      • getDtdSpecValue

        public String getDtdSpecValue(int i)
        Same, but use this one when there are multiple dtds allowed. No range checking done here, use responsibly.

      • getDummyXml

        public InputSource getDummyXml()
        If -s or -p were used, this should hold the dummy XML file

      • getDummyXml

        public InputSource getDummyXml(int i)
        Same, but use this one when there are multiple dtds allowed. No range checking done here, use responsibly.

      • getDtdTitle

        public String getDtdTitle()
        If --title was given, this returns the value, otherwise null.

      • getDtdTitle

        public String getDtdTitle(int i)
        Same, but use this when there are multiple dtds allowed. No range checking done here, use responsibly.

      • getResolver

        public org.apache.xml.resolver.tools.CatalogResolver getResolver()
        If --catalog was given, this will return a valid object, otherwise null.

      • getXslt

        public Transformer getXslt()
        If --xslt was given, this will return a Transformer object. Even if not, this will return a Transformer that does the identity transformation.

      • setXslt

        public void setXslt(Transformer _xslt)
        Allows an application class to set the XSLT transformer object.

      • getRoots

        public String[] getRoots()
        If --roots was given, this returns the value as an array

      • getXsltParams

        public ArrayList getXsltParams()
        If --params was given, this returns the keys and values in an alternating array.

      • getDebug

        public boolean getDebug()
        If --debug was given, this returns true, otherwise false.

      • getOutput

        public StreamResult getOutput()
        Get the output file/stream. This will only be initialized if wantOutput was true when you called the constructor.

      • printUsage

        public void printUsage()
        Outputs usage message to standard output

      • printUsage

        public void printUsage(OutputStream os)
        Outputs the usage message to an output stream (System.out or System.err).

      • usageError

        public void usageError(String msg)
        Use this when there's a serious error in the command line
